snippet: The Palestinian president said the boy had been summarily killed on a Jerusalem street. An Israeli hospital showed him convalescing, spoon-fed by a nurse.
abstract: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and Palestinian leader Mahmoud Abbas trade barbs over treatment of 13-year-old Ahmad Manasra, Arab boy accused of stabbing Israeli cyclist; recent surge in violence between Israelis and Palestinians is exacerbated by conflicting accounts of events, often promoted on social media.

byline.original: By ISABEL KERSHNER and ROBERT MACKEY
byline.contributor: Isabel Kershner reported from Jerusalem, and Robert Mackey from New York.

lead_paragraph: The Palestinian president said the boy had been summarily killed on a Jerusalem street. An Israeli hospital showed him convalescing, spoon-fed by a nurse.

headline.main: Conflicting Accounts of Jerusalem Strife Surround a Wounded Arab Boy
headline.print_headline: Conflicting Accounts of Jerusalem Strife Surround Wounded Boy
